intro: Rodriguezia minor, commonly known as the dwarf rodriguezia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
